items.longDescription:
Lisa Larson

Lisa Larson's warm touch and humorous, cute animal motifs, much loved by fans around the world, are now incorporated into these new designs in calm and gentle colors.

Lisa Larson
Lisa Larson is a Swedish ceramist with many fans worldwide. Larson joined Gustavsberg Factory, a leading Swedish ceramic manufacturer, where for over twenty years, she worked as a designer, producing several hundred pieces of work. In 1980, Larson left Gustavsberg Factory to work independently. In 1992, she established Keramikstudion Gustavsberg, where she continues to create new works to this day.

Â© Lisa & Johanna Larson

items.longDescription:
Keith Haring 1st Exhibition

On view from October 9 - November 13,1982, at the Tony Shafrazi Gallery in NYC, Keith Haring's first major exhibition was energetic and it propelled him onto the main stage of the New York art scene. The opening was packed from wall to wall and artists, art critics, art dealers, friends, and young kids, all mingling and have fun!

Keith Haring
A key figure in New Yorkâ€™s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haringâ€™s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the cityâ€™s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling â€œradiant baby,â€ with abstract marks and patterning.

Â© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.

items.shortDescription: Keith Haring's first exhibition artworks in the UT collection.

items.longDescription:
Lisa Larson

Lisa Larson's warm touch and humorous, cute animal motifs, much loved by fans around the world, are now incorporated into these new designs in calm and gentle colors.

Lisa Larson
Lisa Larson is a Swedish ceramist with many fans worldwide. Larson joined Gustavsberg Factory, a leading Swedish ceramic manufacturer, where for over twenty years, she worked as a designer, producing several hundred pieces of work. In 1980, Larson left Gustavsberg Factory to work independently. In 1992, she established Keramikstudion Gustavsberg, where she continues to create new works to this day.

Â© Lisa & Johanna Larson
